-e ---

ambi umbei bin ב بن
𓍚 𓅱 𓂻 𓆑 near him

PIE *bhi ‘in(side)’ (a well established root)
IEW 34–35, 287 *(m)bhi ‘um-herum, zu beiden Seiten’
Cf. PIE *-bh(y)os ‘Ablative suffix’
Hurrian a-ga-bi ‘on this side’ (< *a-ğho-bhi) (BGH 6–7)
Hurrian -b/w-i (Gen. sg), -b/w-a (Dat. sg)11
Hurrian e-ša-bi, i-ša-bi ‘on that side’ (< *y(o)-so-bhi) (BGH 102–03) The morpheme is only attested as a suffix (or case-marker) in Hurrian.

near 𓂋 𓉔 𓅱 𓏥
